comments.author: Gh0st_Preacher
comments.message:
Do you ever think you'll take down ALARMd? I ask because I use it every weekday as my most effective alarm (it's the only one that freaks me out enough in the morning to get me actively out of bed).

If you were to take it down, what would you do with the brilliant backend you developed for it?

comments.author: Zach Leatherman
comments.message:
I'll tell you two things straight off.

1. There is no backend for the current version of Alarmd.
2. I'm developing a new version of Alarmd that will feature Google Calendar integration. This version may include a backend, and if so, I will publish the code openly.

But as of right now, you can download the current version of Alarmd to your local computer and run it locally. It'll still need internet access if you wake up to a youtube video, but isn't required if you just use mp3's locally.
